intro: Stenostephanus oaxacanus, commonly known as the Oaxacan star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it blooms during the spring season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
